snippet: The British government has said that the break-even point on selling its 39 percent holding in Lloyds is around 61 pence, and the company’s stock is currently trading above that price.
abstract: The British government has said that the break-even point on selling its 39 percent holding in Lloyds is around 61 pence, and the company’s stock is currently trading above that price.

headline.main: Lloyds Banking Group Returns to Profit
